001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.Comparator;
009import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
010import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Locale;
013import java.util.Map;
014import java.util.Objects;
015import java.util.Properties;
016import java.util.Set;
017import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
018import java.util.function.BiFunction;
019import java.util.function.Function;
020import java.util.function.Supplier;
021import java.util.regex.Matcher;
022import java.util.regex.Pattern;
023
024import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
025
026import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogAppender.AppenderFlag;
027import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType;
028import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties;
029import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.FoundProperty.ListProperty;
030import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.FoundProperty.MapProperty;
031import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.FoundProperty.StringProperty;
032import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.MutableLogProperties;
033import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
034import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
035
036/**
037 * Provides String based properties like {@link System#getProperty(String)} for default
038 * configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbow Gum is configuration agnostic
039 * LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any
040 * configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is
041 * {@link #valueOrNull(String)} and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but
042 * using {@link LogProperties#builder()} is preferred so that a
043 * {@linkplain #description(String) description} can be added.
044 * <p>
045 * If a custom {@link LogProperties} is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System
046 * properties.
047 * <p>
048 * The built-in properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after <a href=
049 * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.1.0/reference/html/features.html#features.logging">
050 * Spring Boot logging </a>
051 * <p>
052 * LogProperties should generally be accessed with the {@link LogProperty.PropertyGetter}
053 * and {@link LogProperty.Property} like-monads which will allow safe
054 * <em>programmatic</em> data conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages
055 * to users if the property cannot be mapped or is missing. For more <em>declarative</em>
056 * injection of properties see {@link LogConfigurable} which will generate builders that
057 * can use LogProperties.
058 * <p>
059 * Rainbow Gum treats {@value #SEP} in the keys as special separator analogous to
060 * JavaScript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a
061 * wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is
062 * <strong>RECOMMENDED</strong> that there should not be other property key value with a
063 * key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two
064 * properties <code>logging.example=stuff</code>, <code>logging.example.a=A</code> is not
065 * recommended as <code>logging.example</code> is defined as a leaf. The exception to this
066 * rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.
067 * <p>
068 * Rainbow Gum out of the the box supports parsing two formats into properties:
069 * {@link Properties} text, and {@link URI#getRawQuery()} percent encoded query
070 * parameters. The two different formats have different behavior for
071 * {@link #listOrNull(String)} and {@link #mapOrNull(String)}. If a custom format of
072 * LogProperties is created those two methods may need to be extended.
073 * <p>
074 * A convention used through out Rainbow Gum is to have the property names as constants as
075 * it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with
076 * <code>_PROPERTY</code> or <code>_PREFIX</code> the former being a fully qualified key
077 * that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with
078 * "<code>.</code>". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.
079 * <p>
080 * Property keys can be parameterized by using
081 * {@link LogProperties#interpolateKey(String, Map)} and a general pattern is
082 * <code>logging.component.{name}.prop</code> where {@value #NAME} is a parameter. Many
083 * property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.
084 *
085 * <table class="table">
086 * <caption><strong>Built-in Property Patterns</strong></caption>
087 * <tr>
088 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
089 * <th>Description</th>
090 * </tr>
091 * <tr>
092 * <td>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = LEVEL</td>
093 * <td>Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the
094 * root logger. {@link Level#INFO} is the default level for the root logger.</td>
095 * </tr>
096 * <tr>
097 * <td>{@value #CHANGE_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = boolean |
098 * List&lt;{@link ChangeType}&gt;</td>
099 * <td>Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not
100 * allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the
101 * level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the
102 * built-in {@link LogProperties} is generally static (system properties).</td>
103 * </tr>
104 * <tr>
105 * <td>{@value #ROUTES_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
106 * <td>A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set
107 * {@value LogRouter.Router#DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME } is the default.</td>
108 * </tr>
109 * <tr>
110 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
111 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set
112 * {@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} is used.</td>
113 * </tr>
114 * <tr>
115 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY} = <code>URI</code></td>
116 * <td>Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the {@link LogPublisherRegistry}. The
117 * publisher is then configured by properties with {@value #PUBLISHER_PREFIX}.</td>
118 * </tr>
119 * <tr>
120 * <td>{@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
121 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set
122 * {@value LogAppender#CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME} is the default.</td>
123 * </tr>
124 * <tr>
125 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
126 * <td>Looks up an output by URI scheme using the {@link LogOutputRegistry}. The output is
127 * then configured by properties with {@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX}.</td>
128 * </tr>
129 * <tr>
130 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
131 * <td>Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the {@link LogEncoderRegistry}. The encoder
132 * is then configured by properties with {@value #ENCODER_PREFIX}.</td>
133 * </tr>
134 * <tr>
135 * <tr>
136 * <td>{@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
137 * <td>Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the
138 * appender.</td>
139 * </tr>
140 * <tr>
141 * <td>{@value #ENCODER_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
142 * <td>Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the
143 * appender.</td>
144 * </tr>
145 * <tr>
146 * <td>{@value #FILE_PROPERTY} = URI</td>
147 * <td>A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.</td>
148 * </tr>
149 * </table>
150 *
151 * @see LogConfigurable
152 */
153public interface LogProperties {
154
155        /**
156         * properties separator.
157         */
158        static final String SEP = ".";
159
160        /**
161         * Logging properties prefix.
162         */
163        static final String ROOT_PREFIX = "logging" + SEP;
164
165        /**
166         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
167         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
168         */
169        static final String LEVEL_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "level";
170
171        /**
172         * Enabled level groups. The value should be a list of group names used on
173         * {@link #GROUP_PROPERTY}. This is to enable <a href=
174         * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.3.2/reference/features/logging.html#features.logging.log-groups">
175         * Spring Boot like Log Groups </a>. <em>Note that unlike Spring Boot groups are not
176         * enabled unless this property contains the group.</em>
177         */
178        static final String GROUPS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "groups";
179
180        /**
181         * Group property with list of logger names. The level of the group is set with
182         * <code>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + .{name} = Level</code> or on the router itself with
183         * <code>{@value #ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX} + .{name} = Level</code>. This is largely
184         * compatible with <a href=
185         * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.3.2/reference/features/logging.html#features.logging.log-groups">
186         * Spring Boot Log Groups </a>.
187         * @see LevelResolver#parseLevel(String)
188         */
189        static final String GROUP_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "group.{name}";
190
191        /**
192         * Logging change configuration allowed property.
193         */
194        static final String GLOBAL_CHANGE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.change";
195
196        /**
197         * The level threshold of events captured before Rainbow Gum is fully bound. Before
198         * Rainbow Gum is bound events are queued. By default events that are below
199         * <code>INFO</code> are not queued.
200         */
201        static final String GLOBAL_QUEUE_LEVEL_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.queue.level";
202
203        /**
204         * The level threshold of events that will be outputted to standard error if Rainbow
205         * Gum is not bound yet. events that are below <code>INFO</code> are not queued.
206         */
207        static final String GLOBAL_QUEUE_ERROR_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.queue.error";
208
209        /**
210         * Will globally turn of any ANSI escape output as well disable extensions that do
211         * things for ANSI escape like JANSI.
212         */
213        static final String GLOBAL_ANSI_DISABLE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.ansi.disable";
214
215        /**
216         * IF true will provide additional output on errors.
217         */
218        static final String GLOBAL_VERBOSE = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.verbose";
219
220        /**
221         * Logging change properties prefix.
222         */
223        static final String CHANGE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "change";
224
225        /**
226         * Logging file property for default single file appending. The value should be a URI.
227         */
228        static final String FILE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "file.name";
229
230        /**
231         * A common key parameter is called name.
232         */
233        static final String NAME = "name";
234
235        /**
236         * For properties keys that are parameterized with {@value #NAME} the name often used
237         * if not specified is: {@value #DEFAULT_NAME}.
238         */
239        static final String DEFAULT_NAME = "default";
240
241        /**
242         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
243         */
244        static final String OUTPUT_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "output.{" + NAME + "}.";
245
246        /**
247         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
248         */
249        static final String ENCODER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "encoder.{" + NAME + "}.";
250
251        /**
252         * Enabled Logging appenders. The value should be a list of names. This is equivalent
253         * to {@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} with name "default".
254         */
255        static final String APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "appenders";
256
257        /**
258         * Logging appender prefix for configuration.
259         */
260        static final String APPENDER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "appender.{" + NAME + "}.";
261
262        /**
263         * Output appender property.
264         */
265        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "output";
266
267        /**
268         * Encoder appender property.
269         */
270        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "encoder";
271
272        /**
273         * Appender flags. A list of flags (usually comma separated).
274         * @see AppenderFlag
275         */
276        static final String APPENDER_FLAGS_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "flags";
277
278        /**
279         * Logging publisher prefix for configuration.
280         */
281        static final String PUBLISHER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "publisher.{" + NAME + "}.";
282
283        /**
284         * Routes enabled with names comma separated.
285         */
286        static final String ROUTES_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "routes";
287
288        /**
289         * Route prefix for configuration.
290         */
291        static final String ROUTE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "route.{" + NAME + "}.";
292
293        /**
294         * Logging publisher URI property.
295         */
296        static final String ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "publisher";
297
298        /**
299         * Appenders associated with a route comma separated.
300         */
301        static final String ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "appenders";
302
303        /**
304         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
305         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
306         */
307        static final String ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX = ROUTE_PREFIX + "level";
308
309        /**
310         * Route flags.
311         */
312        static final String ROUTE_FLAGS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "flags";
313
314        /**
315         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String)}.
316         * @param key property name.
317         * @return property value.
318         */
319        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key);
320
321        /**
322         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String, String)} with the exception that the
323         * fallback cannot be null and the return cannot be null.
324         * @param key property name.
325         * @param fallback returned if the value is not found and may not be null.
326         * @return value found or fallback.
327         */
328        default String value(String key, String fallback) {
329                Objects.requireNonNull(fallback);
330                String v = valueOrNull(key);
331                if (v != null) {
332                        return v;
333                }
334                return fallback;
335        }
336
337        /**
338         * Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses
339         * {@link #parseList(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
340         * as a list using {@link LogProperties#parseList(String)} but custom implementations
341         * may rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing
342         * configuration system.
343         * @param key property name.
344         * @return list or <code>null</code>.
345         * @apiNote the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates
346         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
347         */
348        default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
349                String s = valueOrNull(key);
350                if (s == null) {
351                        return null;
352                }
353                return parseList(s);
354        }
355
356        /**
357         * Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses
358         * {@link #parseMap(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
359         * as map using {@link LogProperties#parseMap(String)} but custom implementations may
360         * rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing configuration
361         * system.
362         * @param key property name.
363         * @return map or <code>null</code>.
364         * @apiNote the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates
365         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
366         */
367        default @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
368                String s = valueOrNull(key);
369                if (s == null) {
370                        return null;
371                }
372                return parseMap(s);
373        }
374
375        /**
376         * Find <strong>string</strong> property or <code>null</code>.
377         * @param key property name.
378         * @return found property or <code>null</code>
379         */
380        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
381        default FoundProperty.@Nullable StringProperty stringPropertyOrNull(String key) {
382                String v = valueOrNull(key);
383                if (v != null) {
384                        return new FoundProperty.StringProperty(this, key, v);
385                }
386                return null;
387        }
388
389        /**
390         * Find <strong>list</strong> property or <code>null</code>.
391         * @param key property name.
392         * @return found property or <code>null</code>
393         */
394        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
395        default FoundProperty.@Nullable ListProperty listPropertyOrNull(String key) {
396                var v = listOrNull(key);
397                if (v != null) {
398                        return new FoundProperty.ListProperty(this, key, v);
399                }
400                return null;
401        }
402
403        /**
404         * Find <strong>map</strong> property or <code>null</code>.
405         * @param key property name.
406         * @return found property or <code>null</code>
407         */
408        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
409        default FoundProperty.@Nullable MapProperty mapPropertyOrNull(String key) {
410                var v = mapOrNull(key);
411                if (v != null) {
412                        return new FoundProperty.MapProperty(this, key, v);
413                }
414                return null;
415        }
416
417        /**
418         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
419         * values. The first value not missing (not <code>null</code>) will be returned.
420         * @param <T> result type
421         * @param root prefix.
422         * @param key partial key that will have prefix concated on each try of func.
423         * @param func convert function where <code>null</code> return means to keep
424         * searching.
425         * @return closest value or <code>null</code> if no value can be found.
426         * @see #findUpPathOrNull(String, Function)
427         */
428        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
429        default <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findOrNull(String root, String key,
430                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
431                return findUpPathOrNull(key, k -> func.apply(this, concatKey(root, k)));
432        }
433
434        /**
435         * Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
436         * @param key key.
437         * @return usually the key.
438         */
439        default String description(String key) {
440                return key;
441        }
442
443        /**
444         * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher
445         * number gives higher precedence.
446         * @return zero by default.
447         */
448        default int order() {
449                return 0;
450        }
451
452        /**
453         * Found property retrieved from {@link LogProperties}. This is a bridge and meta data
454         * needed for the {@link LogProperty} fluent like monads. It includes the original
455         * value before conversions.
456         *
457         * @apiNote This sealed class is purposely not generic parameterized but you are
458         * allowed to pattern match as the subclasses represent the builtin types of
459         * properties that are supported.
460         */
461        public sealed interface FoundProperty {
462
463                /**
464                 * The originating <em>exact</em> properties that the value was found on.
465                 * @return properties.
466                 */
467                LogProperties properties();
468
469                /**
470                 * The key that was used to find this property.
471                 * @return key also known as property name.
472                 */
473                String key();
474
475                /**
476                 * A string representation of the value that this property has usually for error
477                 * descriptions.
478                 * @return description of value.
479                 */
480                String valueDescription();
481
482                /**
483                 * A found <strong>string</strong> property result which includes the
484                 * <strong>exact</strong> properties where a value was found.
485                 *
486                 * @param properties the <strong>exact</strong> properties where the value was
487                 * found.
488                 * @param key property key.
489                 * @param value property string value.
490                 */
491                public record StringProperty(LogProperties properties, String key, String value) implements FoundProperty {
492                        @Override
493                        public String valueDescription() {
494                                return maybeRedact(value);
495                        }
496
497                        private static final Set<String> REDACTED_KEYS = Set.of("password", "apikey", "secret", "token");
498
499                        private static final String REDACTED_VALUE = "<REDACTED>";
500
501                        private static final String maybeRedact(String input) {
502                                String lower = input.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
503                                if (REDACTED_KEYS.contains(lower)) {
504                                        return REDACTED_VALUE;
505                                }
506                                for (var k : REDACTED_KEYS) {
507                                        if (input.contains(k)) {
508                                                return REDACTED_VALUE;
509                                        }
510                                }
511                                return input;
512                        }
513                }
514
515                /**
516                 * A found <strong>list</strong> property result which includes the
517                 * <strong>exact</strong> properties where a value was found.
518                 *
519                 * @param properties the <strong>exact</strong> properties where the value was
520                 * found.
521                 * @param key property key.
522                 * @param value property string value.
523                 */
524                public record ListProperty(LogProperties properties, String key, List<String> value) implements FoundProperty {
525                        @Override
526                        public String valueDescription() {
527                                return StringProperty.maybeRedact("" + value);
528                        }
529                }
530
531                /**
532                 * A found <strong>map</strong> property result which includes the
533                 * <strong>exact</strong> properties where a value was found.
534                 *
535                 * @param properties the <strong>exact</strong> properties where the value was
536                 * found.
537                 * @param key property key.
538                 * @param value property string value.
539                 */
540                public record MapProperty(LogProperties properties, String key,
541                                Map<String, String> value) implements FoundProperty {
542                        @Override
543                        public String valueDescription() {
544                                return StringProperty.maybeRedact("" + value);
545                        }
546                }
547
548        }
549
550        /**
551         * Abstract log properties builder.
552         *
553         * @param <T> builder.
554         * @apiNote this abstract class can largely be ignored hence why it is sealed.
555         */
556        public sealed abstract class AbstractBuilder<T> {
557
558                /**
559                 * description
560                 */
561                protected @Nullable String description = null;
562
563                /**
564                 * order
565                 */
566                protected int order = 0;
567
568                /**
569                 * rename key
570                 */
571                protected Function<String, String> renameKey = s -> s;
572
573                /**
574                 * fallbacks
575                 */
576                protected List<LogProperties> fallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
577
578                /**
579                 * Ignored.
580                 */
581                protected AbstractBuilder() {
582                }
583
584                /**
585                 * Add a fallback properties.
586                 * @param properties fallback not null.
587                 * @return this.
588                 */
589                public T with(LogProperties properties) {
590                        this.fallbacks.add(properties);
591                        return self();
592                }
593
594                /**
595                 * For returning this.
596                 * @return this builder.
597                 */
598                protected abstract T self();
599
600                /**
601                 * Description for properties.
602                 * @param description not null.
603                 * @return this.
604                 */
605                public T description(String description) {
606                        this.description = description;
607                        return self();
608                }
609
610                /**
611                 * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A
612                 * higher number gives higher precedence.
613                 * @param order order.
614                 * @return this.
615                 */
616                public T order(int order) {
617                        this.order = order;
618                        return self();
619                }
620
621                /**
622                 * Renames the key before it accesses function.
623                 * @param renameKey rename key function.
624                 * @return this.
625                 */
626                public T renameKey(Function<String, String> renameKey) {
627                        this.renameKey = renameKey;
628                        return self();
629                }
630
631                /**
632                 * Removes the prefix from a key before it accesses the underlying properties.
633                 * @param prefix to be removed from start of key.
634                 * @return this.
635                 */
636                public T removeKeyPrefix(String prefix) {
637                        return renameKey(k -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(k, prefix));
638                }
639
640        }
641
642        /**
643         * Builder for properties.
644         */
645        public final static class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
646
647                private @Nullable Function<Builder, LogProperties> provider = null;
648
649                private Builder() {
650                }
651
652                @Override
653                protected Builder self() {
654                        return this;
655                }
656
657                private Builder provider(Function<Builder, LogProperties> provider) {
658                        if (this.provider != null) {
659                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("from already set");
660                        }
661                        this.provider = provider;
662                        return this;
663                }
664
665                /**
666                 * Sets what is called on {@link LogProperties#valueOrNull(String)}.
667                 * @param function valueOrNull func.
668                 * @return this.
669                 */
670                public Builder fromFunction(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, @Nullable String> function) {
671                        return provider((b) -> new DefaultLogProperties(function,
672                                        Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "function"), renameKey, order));
673                }
674
675                /**
676                 * Parses a string as {@link Properties}.
677                 * @param properties properties as a string.
678                 * @return this.
679                 */
680                public Builder fromProperties(String properties) {
681                        if (description == null) {
682                                description = "PROPERTIES_STRING";
683                        }
684                        return fromFunction(PropertiesParser.readProperties(properties)::get);
685                }
686
687                /**
688                 * Parses a string as a URI query string. If the URI has no query portion then it
689                 * will be equivalent to empty properties.
690                 * @param uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and key
691                 * value separator of "<code>=</code>".
692                 * @return this.
693                 */
694                public Builder fromURIQuery(URI uri) {
695                        String query = uri.getRawQuery();
696                        return provider(
697                                        (b) -> queryToProperties(query, Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "URI_QUERY(" + uri + ")")));
698                }
699
700                /**
701                 * Parses a string as a URI query string.
702                 * @param query uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and
703                 * key value separator of "<code>=</code>".
704                 * @return this.
705                 */
706                public Builder fromURIQuery(String query) {
707                        return provider((b) -> queryToProperties(query,
708                                        Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "URI_QUERY(" + query + ")")));
709
710                }
711
712                private MultiMapProperties queryToProperties(@Nullable String query, String description) {
713                        Map<String, List<String>> multiMap;
714                        if (query == null) {
715                                multiMap = Map.of();
716                        }
717                        else {
718                                multiMap = parseMultiMap(query);
719                        }
720                        var properties = new MultiMapProperties(multiMap, description, renameKey, order);
721                        return properties;
722                }
723
724                /**
725                 * Builds LogProperties based on builder config.
726                 * @return this.
727                 */
728                public LogProperties build() {
729                        var f = this.provider;
730                        if (f == null) {
731                                if (!fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
732                                        return LogProperties.of(fallbacks);
733                                }
734                                throw new IllegalStateException("from was not set");
735                        }
736
737                        var first = f.apply(this);
738                        if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
739                                return first;
740                        }
741                        List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
742                        combined.add(first);
743                        combined.addAll(fallbacks);
744                        return LogProperties.of(combined);
745                }
746
747                static abstract class AbstractLogProperties implements LogProperties {
748
749                        protected final String description;
750
751                        protected final Function<String, String> renameKey;
752
753                        protected final int order;
754
755                        public AbstractLogProperties(String description, Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
756                                super();
757                                this.description = description;
758                                this.renameKey = renameKey;
759                                this.order = order;
760                        }
761
762                        @Override
763                        public int order() {
764                                return this.order;
765                        }
766
767                        @Override
768                        public String description(String key) {
769                                String rename = renameKey.apply(key);
770                                return description + "[" + rename + "]";
771                        }
772
773                        @Override
774                        public String toString() {
775                                return getClass().getSimpleName() + "[description='" + description + "', " + "order=" + order + "]";
776                        }
777
778                }
779
780                private static final class DefaultLogProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
781
782                        private final Function<String, @Nullable String> func;
783
784                        public DefaultLogProperties(Function<String, @Nullable String> func, String description,
785                                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
786                                super(description, renameKey, order);
787                                this.func = func;
788                        }
789
790                        @Override
791                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
792                                return func.apply(renameKey.apply(key));
793                        }
794
795                }
796
797        }
798
799        /**
800         * A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
801         */
802        public interface MutableLogProperties extends LogProperties {
803
804                /**
805                 * Assigns key to a value.
806                 * @param key key.
807                 * @param value value if null will remove the key.
808                 * @return this.
809                 */
810                MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value);
811
812                /**
813                 * Copy java.util {@link Properties} String useful for unit testing.
814                 * @param content string in {@link Properties} format (tip use multiline strings).
815                 * @return this.
816                 */
817                default MutableLogProperties copyProperties(String content) {
818                        var m = PropertiesParser.readProperties(content);
819                        for (var e : m.entrySet()) {
820                                put(e.getKey(), e.getKey());
821                        }
822                        return this;
823                }
824
825                /**
826                 * Builder for MutableLogProperties.
827                 * @return builder.
828                 */
829                public static Builder builder() {
830                        return new Builder();
831                }
832
833                /**
834                 * Mutable Log properties builder.
835                 */
836                public final class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
837
838                        private Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
839
840                        private Builder() {
841                        }
842
843                        @Override
844                        protected Builder self() {
845                                return this;
846                        }
847
848                        /**
849                         * Sets the backing mutable map.
850                         * @param map backing map.
851                         * @return this.
852                         */
853                        public Builder with(Map<String, String> map) {
854                                this.map = map;
855                                return this;
856                        }
857
858                        /**
859                         * Parses a string as {@link Properties} useful for unit testing with Java
860                         * multiline string literal.
861                         * @param properties properties as a string.
862                         * @return this.
863                         */
864                        public Builder copyProperties(String properties) {
865                                map.putAll(PropertiesParser.readProperties(properties));
866                                return this;
867                        }
868
869                        /**
870                         * Builds a mutable log properties.
871                         * @return mutable log properties.
872                         */
873                        public MutableLogProperties build() {
874                                String description = this.description;
875                                if (description == null) {
876                                        description = "custom mutable";
877                                }
878                                var first = new MapLogProperties(map, description, renameKey, order);
879                                if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
880                                        return first;
881                                }
882                                List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
883                                combined.add(first);
884                                combined.addAll(fallbacks);
885                                return new CompositeMutableLogProperties(sort(combined));
886                        }
887
888                        private static final class MapLogProperties extends LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties
889                                        implements MutableLogProperties {
890
891                                private final Map<String, String> map;
892
893                                public MapLogProperties(Map<String, String> map, String description, Function<String, String> renameKey,
894                                                int order) {
895                                        super(description, renameKey, order);
896                                        this.map = map;
897                                }
898
899                                @Override
900                                public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
901                                        return map.get(renameKey.apply(key));
902                                }
903
904                                @Override
905                                public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
906                                        Objects.requireNonNull(key);
907                                        key = renameKey.apply(key);
908                                        if (value == null) {
909                                                map.remove(key);
910                                                return this;
911                                        }
912                                        map.put(key, value);
913                                        return this;
914                                }
915
916                        }
917
918                }
919
920        }
921
922        /**
923         * LogProperties builder.
924         * @return builder.
925         */
926        public static Builder builder() {
927                return new Builder();
928        }
929
930        /**
931         * Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set
932         * use system properties. <strong>This method should be used sparingly and is
933         * preferred that you get the properties through a config instance instead.</strong>
934         * @return currently bound properties or system properties.
935         * @apiNote the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton
936         * components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that
937         * need to determine if they should be enabled.
938         */
939        public static LogProperties findGlobalProperties() {
940                return findGlobalProperties(() -> StandardProperties.SYSTEM_PROPERTIES);
941        }
942
943        /**
944         * Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set
945         * use the supplier as the fallback. <strong>This method should be used sparingly and
946         * is preferred that you get the properties through a config instance
947         * instead.</strong>
948         * @param fallback supplier to use if no rainbow gum is bound.
949         * @return currently bound properties or fallback.
950         * @apiNote the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton
951         * components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that
952         * need to determine if they should be enabled.
953         */
954        public static LogProperties findGlobalProperties(Supplier<? extends LogProperties> fallback) {
955                var gum = RainbowGum.getOrNull();
956                if (gum != null) {
957                        return gum.config().properties();
958                }
959                return Objects.requireNonNull(fallback.get());
960        }
961
962        /**
963         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
964         * @param logProperties list of properties.
965         * @param fallback if the logProperties list is empty.
966         * @return log properties
967         */
968        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback) {
969                if (logProperties.isEmpty()) {
970                        return fallback;
971                }
972                if (logProperties.size() == 1) {
973                        return Objects.requireNonNull(logProperties.get(0));
974                }
975                var array = sort(logProperties);
976                return new CompositeLogProperties(array);
977        }
978
979        private static LogProperties[] sort(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
980                @SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse array issue
981                LogProperties[] array = logProperties.stream()
982                        .filter(p -> p != StandardProperties.EMPTY)
983                        .toArray(size -> new LogProperties[size]);
984                Arrays.sort(array, Comparator.comparingInt(LogProperties::order).reversed());
985                return array;
986        }
987
988        /**
989         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
990         * @param logProperties the list of properties.
991         * @return if the logProperties is empty {@link StandardProperties#EMPTY} will be
992         * used.
993         */
994        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
995                return of(logProperties, StandardProperties.EMPTY);
996        }
997
998        /**
999         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
1000         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
1001         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
1002         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
1003         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
1004         * properties.
1005         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
1006         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
1007         * parameters.
1008         */
1009        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties) {
1010                return of(uri, prefix, properties, null);
1011        }
1012
1013        /**
1014         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
1015         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
1016         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
1017         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
1018         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
1019         * properties.
1020         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
1021         * @param uriKey where the URI came from.
1022         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
1023         * parameters.
1024         */
1025        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties, @Nullable String uriKey) {
1026                /*
1027                 * TODO this should be integrated with the whole providers and registries.
1028                 */
1029                String propDesc = uriKey != null ? "[" + uriKey + "]->" : "";
1030                String description = propDesc + "URI(" + uri + ")";
1031                var uriProperties = LogProperties.builder()
1032                        .description(description)
1033                        .fromURIQuery(uri)
1034                        .renameKey(s -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(s, prefix))
1035                        .build();
1036                return LogProperties.of(List.of(properties, uriProperties));
1037        }
1038
1039        /**
1040         * Parse a {@linkplain URI#getRawQuery() URI query} in <a href=
1041         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
1042         * application/x-www-form-urlencoded </a> format useful for parsing properties values
1043         * that have key values embedded in them. <strong>This parser unlike form encoding
1044         * uses <code>%20</code> for space as the data is coming from a URI.</strong>
1045         * @param query raw query component of URI.
1046         * @param consumer accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does
1047         * not have a "<code>=</code>" following it the second parameter on the consumer
1048         * accept will be passed <code>null</code>.
1049         */
1050        public static void parseUriQuery(String query,
1051                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
1052                parseUriQuery(query, true, consumer);
1053        }
1054
1055        /**
1056         * Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
1057         * @param query raw query component of URI.
1058         * @return decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
1059         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
1060         */
1061        public static Map<String, String> parseMap(String query) {
1062                Map<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1063                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> {
1064                        if (v != null) {
1065                                m.put(k, v);
1066                        }
1067                });
1068                return m;
1069        }
1070
1071        /**
1072         * Parses a URI query for a multiple value map. The list values of the map maybe empty
1073         * if the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be
1074         * the case if there is a parameter (key) with no "<code>=</code>" following it. For
1075         * example the following would have three entries of <code>a,b,c</code> all with empty
1076         * list: <pre>
1077         * <code>
1078         * a&amp;b&amp;c&amp;
1079         * </code> </pre>
1080         * @param query raw query component of URI.
1081         * @return decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
1082         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
1083         */
1084        public static Map<String, List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query) {
1085                Map<String, List<String>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1086                BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> f = (k, v) -> {
1087                        List<String> list = Objects.requireNonNull(m.computeIfAbsent(k, _k -> new ArrayList<String>()));
1088                        if (v != null) {
1089                                list.add(v);
1090                        }
1091                };
1092                parseUriQuery(query, f);
1093                return m;
1094        }
1095
1096        /**
1097         * Parses a list of strings from a string that is <a href=
1098         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
1099         * percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded)</a> where the
1100         * separator can be either "<code>&amp;</code>" or "<code>,</code>".
1101         * <p>
1102         * An example would be using ampersand: <pre><code>
1103         *  "a&amp;b%20B&amp;c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
1104         *  </code> </pre> and comma: <pre><code>
1105         *  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
1106         *  </code> </pre>
1107         * @param query the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
1108         * @return list of strings
1109         */
1110        public static List<String> parseList(String query) {
1111                List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
1112                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> list.add(k));
1113                return list;
1114        }
1115
1116        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
1117                parseUriQuery(query, decode, "[&,]", consumer);
1118        }
1119
1120        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, String sep,
1121                        BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
1122                /*
1123                 * TODO default java split has issues but is very fast
1124                 */
1125                @SuppressWarnings("StringSplitter")
1126                String[] pairs = query.split(sep);
1127                for (String pair : pairs) {
1128                        int idx = pair.indexOf("=");
1129                        String key;
1130                        String value;
1131                        if (idx == 0) {
1132                                continue;
1133                        }
1134                        else if (idx < 0) {
1135                                key = pair;
1136                                value = null;
1137                        }
1138                        else {
1139                                key = pair.substring(0, idx);
1140                                value = pair.substring(idx + 1);
1141                        }
1142                        if (decode) {
1143                                key = PercentCodec.decode(key, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
1144                                if (value != null) {
1145                                        value = PercentCodec.decode(value, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
1146                                }
1147
1148                        }
1149                        if (key.isBlank()) {
1150                                continue;
1151                        }
1152                        consumer.accept(key, value);
1153                }
1154        }
1155
1156        /**
1157         * Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
1158         */
1159        @CaseChanging
1160        enum StandardProperties implements LogProperties {
1161
1162                /**
1163                 * Empty properties. The order is <code>-1</code>.
1164                 */
1165                EMPTY {
1166                        @Override
1167                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1168                                return null;
1169                        }
1170
1171                        @Override
1172                        public int order() {
1173                                return -1;
1174                        }
1175                },
1176                /**
1177                 * Uses {@link System#getProperty(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}. The
1178                 * {@link #order()} is <code>400</code> which the same value as MicroProfile
1179                 * config ordinal.
1180                 */
1181                SYSTEM_PROPERTIES {
1182                        @Override
1183                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1184                                return System.getProperty(key);
1185                        }
1186
1187                        @Override
1188                        public int order() {
1189                                return 400;
1190                        }
1191                },
1192                /**
1193                 * Uses {@link System#getenv(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}.The
1194                 * {@link #order()} is <code>300</code> which is the same value as MicroProfile
1195                 * config ordinal.
1196                 */
1197                ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES {
1198                        @Override
1199                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1200                                return System.getenv(translateKey(key));
1201                        }
1202
1203                        @Override
1204                        protected String translateKey(String key) {
1205                                return key.replace(".", "_");
1206                        }
1207
1208                };
1209
1210                @Override
1211                public String description(String key) {
1212                        String k = translateKey(key);
1213                        return name() + "[" + k + "]";
1214                }
1215
1216                /**
1217                 * Translate the key.
1218                 * @param key input
1219                 * @return output
1220                 */
1221                protected String translateKey(String key) {
1222                        return key;
1223                }
1224
1225        }
1226
1227        /**
1228         * Searches a {@value LogProperties#SEP} separated property path recursing up the path
1229         * till a non null value (not missing) is found.
1230         * <p>
1231         * For example assume we have a single property set like
1232         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG</code> and we call this function with
1233         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code>.
1234         * <ol>
1235         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1236         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1237         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff</code> will resolve to <code>"DEBUG"</code>, stop
1238         * and return <code>"DEBUG"</code>.</li>
1239         * </ol>
1240         * @param <T> type to return.
1241         * @param key the initial path.
1242         * @param resolveFunc function that returns the value at path or <code>null</code>.
1243         * @return value or <code>null</code> if no non null value can be found.
1244         */
1245        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
1246        public static <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findUpPathOrNull(String key,
1247                        Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc) {
1248                return searchPath(key, resolveFunc, SEP);
1249        }
1250
1251        private static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc, String sep) {
1252                String tempName = key;
1253                @Nullable
1254                T level = null;
1255                int indexOfLastDot = tempName.length();
1256                while ((level == null) && (indexOfLastDot > -1)) {
1257                        tempName = tempName.substring(0, indexOfLastDot);
1258                        level = resolveFunc.apply(tempName);
1259                        indexOfLastDot = tempName.lastIndexOf(sep);
1260                }
1261                if (level != null) {
1262                        return level;
1263                }
1264                return resolveFunc.apply("");
1265        }
1266
1267        /**
1268         * Concats a key using {@link #SEP} to the root prefix.
1269         * @param name key.
1270         * @return concat key.
1271         */
1272        static String concatKey(String name) {
1273                return concatKey(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX, name);
1274        }
1275
1276        /**
1277         * Concats a keys using {@link #SEP} as the separator.
1278         * @param prefix start of key.
1279         * @param name second part of key.
1280         * @return key.
1281         */
1282        static String concatKey(String prefix, String name) {
1283                if (name.equals("")) {
1284                        return prefix;
1285                }
1286                if (prefix.equals("")) {
1287                        return name;
1288                }
1289                if (prefix.endsWith(".")) {
1290                        prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
1291                }
1292                if (name.startsWith(SEP)) {
1293                        return prefix + name;
1294                }
1295                return prefix + SEP + name;
1296        }
1297
1298        /**
1299         * Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
1300         * @param key property name.
1301         * @param parameters tokens to replace with entry values.
1302         * @return interpolated property key.
1303         * @see #interpolateKey(String, Function)
1304         */
1305        static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String, String> parameters) {
1306                return interpolateKey(key, parameters::get);
1307        }
1308
1309        /**
1310         * Replaces property <strong>key</strong> parameters by using the lookup function.
1311         * Property keys are often parameterized usually by some name. The parameters are
1312         * surrounded by curly braces and replaced by the lookup function. An example of the
1313         * format is <code>a.{PARAM}</code> which has a parameter named <code>PARAM</code>. If
1314         * the lookup function has <code>PARAM->b</code> then the result will be
1315         * <code>a.b</code>. If a value for a parameter is null (indicates not found) an
1316         * exception is thrown.
1317         * @param key to be interpolated.
1318         * @param lookup function that may return null for a parameter.
1319         * @return interpolated key with all parameters replaced.
1320         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the lookup function does not have a value for a
1321         * parameter.
1322         */
1323        public static String interpolateKey(String key,
1324                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, ? extends @Nullable String> lookup)
1325                        throws IllegalArgumentException {
1326                var parameters = keyParameters(key);
1327                String result = key;
1328                for (String k : parameters) {
1329                        var v = lookup.apply(k);
1330                        if (v == null) {
1331                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1332                                                "Keyed parameter missing. key: '" + key + "' parameter: '" + k + "'");
1333                        }
1334                        result = result.replace("{" + k + "}", v);
1335                }
1336                return result;
1337        }
1338
1339        /**
1340         * Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a {@value #NAME}.
1341         * @param key with name parameters.
1342         * @param name replace name token.
1343         * @return interpolated property key.
1344         */
1345        static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name) {
1346                return interpolateKey(key, Map.of(NAME, name));
1347        }
1348
1349        /**
1350         * Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not
1351         * check that.
1352         * @param key key whose prefix will be removed.
1353         * @param prefix property name prefix.
1354         * @return prefix removed if the string is prefixed.
1355         */
1356        static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix) {
1357                if (key.startsWith(prefix)) {
1358                        return key.substring(prefix.length());
1359                }
1360                return key;
1361        }
1362
1363        /**
1364         * Property prefix parameter pattern.
1365         */
1366        static final Pattern PARAMETER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\{(.*?)\\}");
1367
1368        /**
1369         * Extract key parameters with {@link #PARAMETER_PATTERN}.
1370         * @param key also known as property name.
1371         * @return parameters in key.
1372         */
1373        static Set<String> keyParameters(String key) {
1374                Set<String> tokens = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1375                Matcher matcher = PARAMETER_PATTERN.matcher(key);
1376                while (matcher.find()) {
1377                        var t = matcher.group(1);
1378                        if (t == null) {
1379                                throw new IllegalStateException("bug with parameter pattern regex.");
1380                        }
1381                        tokens.add(t);
1382                }
1383                return tokens;
1384        }
1385
1386        /**
1387         * Validate key parameters.
1388         * @param key key to be interpolated with parameters.
1389         * @param parameters names of parameters which must <strong>equal</strong> the set of
1390         * the found parameters. while the order obviously does not matter the set cannot have
1391         * more parameters than found in the key.
1392         */
1393        static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters) {
1394                var keyParameters = keyParameters(key);
1395                if (!parameters.equals(keyParameters)) {
1396                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyed parameter mismatch. key: '" + key + "' , key parameters: "
1397                                        + keyParameters + " provided parameters: " + parameters);
1398                }
1399        }
1400
1401}
1402
1403final class MultiMapProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
1404
1405        private final Map<String, List<String>> multiMap;
1406
1407        public MultiMapProperties(Map<String, List<String>> multiMap, String description,
1408                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
1409                super(description, renameKey, order);
1410                this.multiMap = multiMap;
1411        }
1412
1413        @Override
1414        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1415                return _valueOrNull(renameKey.apply(key));
1416        }
1417
1418        private @Nullable String _valueOrNull(String key) {
1419                var list = multiMap.get(key);
1420                if (list == null || list.isEmpty()) {
1421                        return null;
1422                }
1423                return list.get(0);
1424        }
1425
1426        @Override
1427        public @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
1428                return multiMap.get(renameKey.apply(key));
1429        }
1430
1431        @Override
1432        public @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
1433                /*
1434                 * Now we check for dotted notation since key was not set. key.subkey=value
1435                 */
1436                String prefix = renameKey.apply(key) + LogProperties.SEP;
1437                LinkedHashMap<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1438                for (var k : multiMap.keySet()) {
1439                        if (k.startsWith(prefix) && !k.equals(prefix)) {
1440                                String v = _valueOrNull(k);
1441                                if (v != null) {
1442                                        String _k = k.substring(prefix.length());
1443                                        m.put(_k, v);
1444                                }
1445                        }
1446                }
1447                return m;
1448        }
1449
1450}
1451
1452interface ListLogProperties extends LogProperties {
1453
1454        @Override
1455        default @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1456                for (var props : properties()) {
1457                        var value = props.valueOrNull(key);
1458                        if (value != null) {
1459                                return value;
1460                        }
1461                }
1462                return null;
1463        }
1464
1465        @Override
1466        default @Nullable StringProperty stringPropertyOrNull(String key) {
1467                for (var props : properties()) {
1468                        var value = props.stringPropertyOrNull(key);
1469                        if (value != null) {
1470                                return value;
1471                        }
1472                }
1473                return null;
1474        }
1475
1476        @Override
1477        default @Nullable ListProperty listPropertyOrNull(String key) {
1478                for (var props : properties()) {
1479                        var value = props.listPropertyOrNull(key);
1480                        if (value != null) {
1481                                return value;
1482                        }
1483                }
1484                return null;
1485        }
1486
1487        @Override
1488        default @Nullable MapProperty mapPropertyOrNull(String key) {
1489                for (var props : properties()) {
1490                        var value = props.mapPropertyOrNull(key);
1491                        if (value != null) {
1492                                return value;
1493                        }
1494                }
1495                return null;
1496        }
1497
1498        @Override
1499        default String description(String key) {
1500                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1501                boolean first = true;
1502                for (var p : properties()) {
1503                        if (first) {
1504                                first = false;
1505                        }
1506                        else {
1507                                sb.append(", ");
1508                        }
1509                        sb.append(p.description(key));
1510                }
1511                return sb.toString();
1512        }
1513
1514        LogProperties[] properties();
1515
1516        default StringBuilder toString(StringBuilder sb) {
1517                sb.append(getClass().getSimpleName());
1518                sb.append("[properties=").append(Arrays.deepToString(properties())).append("]");
1519                return sb;
1520        }
1521
1522}
1523
1524@SuppressWarnings("ArrayRecordComponent") // TODO we did this originall because it was hot
1525                                                                                        // path but not anymore
1526record CompositeMutableLogProperties(LogProperties[] properties) implements ListLogProperties, MutableLogProperties {
1527
1528        @Override
1529        public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
1530                for (var p : properties()) {
1531                        if (p instanceof MutableLogProperties mp && mp != this) {
1532                                mp.put(key, value);
1533                                return this;
1534                        }
1535                }
1536                return this;
1537        }
1538
1539        @Override
1540        public String toString() {
1541                return toString(new StringBuilder()).toString();
1542        }
1543
1544}
1545
1546@SuppressWarnings("ArrayRecordComponent") // TODO we did this originall because it was hot
1547                                                                                        // path but not anymore
1548record CompositeLogProperties(LogProperties[] properties) implements ListLogProperties {
1549        @Override
1550        public String toString() {
1551                return toString(new StringBuilder()).toString();
1552        }
1553}
